column4: hey guys how I having a ton of trouble trying to remove the grub bootloader
and restore my windows bootloader
I removed my ubuntu partition and then now I keep getting the grub error 22
can anyone help me?
trying to boot to windows?
or another linux distro?
yes I have removed the ext3 and swap partitions
hrm.. i asked if you were trying to boot to windows... or another linux... please differentiate
I have booted into the xp disk and tried to execute fixmbr and fixboot but I still can't seem to remove the grub bootloader
lol
hrm
sorry I'm trying to boot into windows
that should have wiped it out for you
I know its strange, maybe I will boot into the Ubuntu LIve cd and check it out with gparted, do you think I will see it in there?
unless you installed grub on your windows partition
lol
that would explain a grub error.
bah
gotta buy it
well i will look into it.  ty  blackest_knight
I am looking at my hardrive in gparted and there is a fat16 DellUtility ntfs and fat32, there is no trace of my Ubuntu partition I don't understand where the grub bootloader is hidden?
hmm how can I remove it and restore the windows default bootloader?
you *could* get a floppy disk, quick format it, and throw a valid boot.ini, ntldr and ntdetect on it and see if it'll boot
